description.narrative: Communication in multiple media and fora draw on evidence, and leverage a spectrum of partnerships to support public advocacy and engagement for the promotion, protection and fulfilment of children's rights.

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2019 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communication in multiple media and fora draw on evidence, and leverage a spectrum of partnerships to support public advocacy and engagement for the promotion, protection and fulfilment of children’s rights.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to be the leading voice on children in Afghanistan in mass media as well as social media platforms. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Number of initiatives that engage civil society partners and/or coalitions to advocate together with UNICEF for children
Number of high-profile individuals (including GWAs, influencers, political/community/religious leaders, etc.) who publicly support/amplify UNICEF advocacy messages and initiatives
Number of followers across all UNICEF social media channels
Share of Voice on child-related issues in traditional media in the context of country priorities (measured against comparative organizations)

target.value: 2020:1 Comprehensive Advocacy Strategy developed with a complementary action plan and endorsed by CMT

title.narrative: Number of social media engagements across all UNICEF social media channels
Percentage of returning visitors to UNICEF websites and blogs
Child (aged 9-12) participation platforms/spaces established and functional

target.value: 2020:5 children's (aged 9-12) platforms established and functional at regional level

title.narrative: Number of people reached on UNICEF social media channels
Number of articles/stories with UNICEF mentions in top-tier media outlets

target.value: 2020:Reach and engage with 50,000 children and adolescents
